OptimalBinningWoE 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Generates a Gains Table from the Weight of Evidence (WoE) and target feature data

OptimalBinningGainsTableFeature.Rd

This function takes a numeric vector of Weight of Evidence (WoE) values and the corresponding binary target variable to generate a gains table. The table includes key metrics such as counts, event rates, cumulative sums, Kolmogorov-Smirnov (KS) statistic, Information Value (IV), odds ratio, lift, and Gini contribution for each unique WoE bin.

Usage

OptimalBinningGainsTableFeature(feature_woe, target)

Arguments

feature_woe

Numeric vector representing the Weight of Evidence (WoE) values for each observation.

target

Numeric vector representing the binary target variable, where 1 indicates a positive event (e.g., default) and 0 indicates a negative event (e.g., non-default).

Value

A data frame containing the following columns for each unique WoE bin:

  • bin: The bin labels.

  • count: Total count of observations in each bin.

  • pos: Count of positive events in each bin.

  • neg: Count of negative events in each bin.

  • woe: Weight of Evidence (WoE) value for each bin.

  • iv: Information Value (IV) contribution for each bin.

  • total_iv: Total Information Value (IV) across all bins.

  • cum_pos: Cumulative count of positive events up to the current bin.

  • cum_neg: Cumulative count of negative events up to the current bin.

  • pos_rate: Rate of positive events in each bin.

  • neg_rate: Rate of negative events in each bin.

  • pos_perc: Percentage of positive events relative to the total positive events.

  • neg_perc: Percentage of negative events relative to the total negative events.

  • count_perc: Percentage of total observations in each bin.

  • cum_count_perc: Cumulative percentage of observations up to the current bin.

  • cum_pos_perc: Cumulative percentage of positive events up to the current bin.

  • cum_neg_perc: Cumulative percentage of negative events up to the current bin.

  • cum_pos_perc_total: Cumulative percentage of positive events relative to the total observations.

  • cum_neg_perc_total: Cumulative percentage of negative events relative to the total observations.

  • odds_pos: Odds of positive events in each bin.

  • odds_ratio: Odds ratio of positive events in the bin compared to the total population.

  • lift: Lift of the bin, calculated as the ratio of the positive rate in the bin to the overall positive rate.

  • ks: Kolmogorov-Smirnov statistic, measuring the difference between cumulative positive and negative percentages.

  • gini_contribution: Contribution to the Gini coefficient for each bin.

Details

The function assumes that both feature_woe and target have the same length. It groups the target values by the unique WoE values, computes various metrics for each group, and returns a comprehensive gains table.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
feature_woe <- c(-0.5, 0.2, 0.2, -0.5, 0.3)
target <- c(1, 0, 1, 0, 1)
gains_table <- OptimalBinningGainsTableFeature(feature_woe, target)
} # }
